description_txt: stated on August 13, 2017 in a Facebook live video:
quote_txt: "Seventy-three percent of our veterans are graduating from drug courts. By contrast, I think most of the people in the very good drug court program — the graduation rate’s like 53, 55 percent. The point of that is that drug courts are working for veterans."

description_txt: stated on October 6, 2017 in a statement:
quote_txt: "Women in our state will continue to have cost-free access to reproductive health care"

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2017 in remarks before the NE Tarrant Tea Party group:
quote_txt: On preserving 60-vote threshold to end a Senate filibuster.

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: The state and local tax deduction is a major benefit for moderate-income households because "50% of households that claim State & Local Tax deduction make under $100K."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2017 in a White House briefing:
quote_txt: At a 2015 dedication of an FBI building in Florida, Rep. Frederica Wilson "stood up there ... and talked about how she was instrumental in getting the funding for that building, and how she took care of her constituents because she got the money, and she just called up President Obama, and on that phone call he gave the money -- the $20 million -- to build the building. And she sat down."

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2017 in House floor remarks:
quote_txt: Says "80 percent of the tax breaks in" President Donald Trump’s tax-cut "proposal go to the top 1 percent, that is, people making more than $730,000 a year."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2017 in the "Alamo Truth" website funded by George P. Bush's political campaign:
quote_txt: "The Alamo has been consistently listed as one of the most disappointing landmarks in our nation."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2017 in a news article:
quote_txt: An undocumented immigrant "was arrested on suspicion of arson in (the) Wine Country fires that have killed at least 40 residents."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: In 2016, there were 5,570 people in Wisconsin "who committed crimes on probation and they were not revoked."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2017 in a speech:
quote_txt: "And over the last six years, Chicago’s economy has grown faster than the economies of New York City, Washington, D.C., or the national average."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2017 in in an interview:
quote_txt: NFL players taking a knee during the national anthem is "against the law."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2017 in a speech:
quote_txt: In the U.S. asylum system, "claims of 'fear to return' have skyrocketed, and the percentage of claims that are genuinely meritorious are down."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2017 in comments on ABC:
quote_txt: "And I think that his engagement with Congress is something that never happened under President Obama. They were never allowed to debate it. They were never allowed to discuss it. So, now Congress is going to be fully engaged on the threats of Iran."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2017 in an interview with Channel 8:
quote_txt: "The child tax credit, if we don't do it, there will be no tax relief for working families. How much tax relief working families get under tax reform is entirely dependent on whether or not we put in place an increase to the child tax credit."

description_txt: stated on July 31, 2017 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "In the eight years that I was mayor, (there was a) nearly 50 percent drop in violent crime, gang crime — crime went down because we grew our police department, we focused on constitutional community policing, we did some of the most innovative prevention, intervention, job re-entry programs in the nation."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2017 in in a press conference:
quote_txt: Says she debated her opponent "multiple times."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2017 in an interview with E.W. Scripps television:
quote_txt: "We're the highest developed nation taxed in the world."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2017 in a White House cabinet meeting:
quote_txt: "The cost-sharing reductions (were) a gift (that) they gave the insurance companies."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: "Hillary (Clinton) caught on tape laughing about (Hurricane) Irma ‘wiping out all of those Florida hillbillies’."

description_txt: stated on October 4, 2017 in a video:
quote_txt: "Job creation fell by 70 percent in Wisconsin in 2016" under Scott Walker.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: "San Juan city council votes unanimously to impeach Trump-hating mayor."

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2017 in a public forum:
quote_txt: Says Stacey Evans "voted for (school) vouchers...in the beginning."

description_txt: stated on October 5, 2017 in an op-ed in the "Tulsa World":
quote_txt: "State government spending is at an all-time high. The state is on track to spend more in this fiscal year — more than $17.9 billion — than at any time in state history."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Our tax code has nearly doubled since 1985."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2017 in a CNN "State of the Union" interview:
quote_txt: "The president early on called on NATO member countries to step up their contributions ... and as a result of that countries have stepped up contributions toward their own defense."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2017 in in a press conference:
quote_txt: Says he got "support all over Raleigh"

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2017 in a Weekend Update report on NBC-TV's "Saturday Night Live":
quote_txt: "There is a real law in Texas that says it’s illegal to own more than six dildos."

name_txt: Ohioans Against Deceptive Rx Ballot Issue
description_txt: stated on May 23, 2017 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "A California health care CEO is promising to reduce our prescription drug costs."

name_txt: Ohio Taxpayers for Lower Drug Prices
description_txt: stated on August 29, 2017 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: An Ohio ballot issue would address the fact that "we’ve gone from paying about $100 for Epipens to over $600 ... We don’t have a choice but to pay it and the drug companies know it."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: The Republican tax reform proposal is focused on tax breaks for the middle class "and not about people who are really high-income earners getting a tax break."
